attributes.action: Offer U.K. citizenship to all E.U. citizens with permanent residence status
attributes.background:
There are many eu citizens who have built a life for themselves in this country over many years. Their children may have been educated here, they may bought property or married u.k. citizens,.
as things stand despite all they have contributed they face an uncertain future. They deserve security

attributes.action: Improve category 1 plug in car grants after March 2017 review
attributes.background: Category 1 electric vehicle technology is taking off. These cars can now give around 300 miles in range, matching the average internal combustion engine. These electric cars are becoming more attractive to buyers. In order to help the UK beat and exceed emission targets, ev's must be promoted.

attributes.action: Suspend hospital fines for breaches in 4h waits in Emergency Departments
attributes.background: The Standard Contract for NHS Providers in 2015-16 charges hospitals £120 for every breach of the 4h wait times over the target in Emergency Departments. With unprecedented pressure on Emergency Departments currently this is an absurd system of punishing hospitals for being busy.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Health Committee "Winter pressure in accident and emergency departments Third Report of Session 2016–17" demonstrates that compliance with 4h targets plummets every winter (85% in 2015, 80% in 2016) and demand is currently higher than ever. Hospitals are paying the price of chronic government underfunding of Primary Care and Community Care, and to financially penalise hospitals for flawed government policy is clearly absurd.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Service to calculate payments based on annual basic net pay.
attributes.background: Calculations shouldn't include overtime, shift allowances nor any bonuses.
attributes.additional_details: Receiving parents to provide evidence of what they spend child maintenance on

attributes.action: Stop Govia Thameslink( GTR) from being allowed to increase fares in 2017
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink the owners of Southern Rail have consistently failed to provide a service which could be considered acceptable in any reasonable way. 
With both individuals and businesses losing millions they should not be allowed to raise fares when they are not providing a proper service.
attributes.additional_details:
With well documented proof that they have consistently failed to provide a proper service, have left passengers stranded and have cost individuals & businesses millions in lost revenue collectively the owners of Southern Rail should have no automatic right to increase fares when they have failed miserably to provide an acceptable service for the last 8 months of 2016. 

This issue has been raised in the house several times and is public knowledge.

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Make Politics a mandatory subject for the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: Elections in the US and the recent Brexit vote demonstrate key decisions that the people need to have a good background in Politics to vote on. Giving an education promotes this exploration of politics earlier than just 6 months before a referendum/election. Students can make up their own mind.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-1.png

http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-2.png

People need the chance to have an educated vote, not voting on personality or party without understanding.

attributes.action: Ban the use of zoos as a tourist attraction
attributes.background: Zoos set a limit on animal freedom, it is wrong that just because we are the dominant and most forward thinking species that we should capture and restraint the freedom of other animals for our own entertainment. I am petitioning to end animal captivity and give every animal the freedom it deserves.
attributes.additional_details: The world is developing at an extremely fast rate and traditions are not the only things fading out. It is estimated that 99% of all species that have lived on earth are now extinct, and over 150,000 become extinct every day. these animals have limited lives as it is, and it isn't right for us as a dominant and prosperous species to constrain the animals to a restricted life in a cage.

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Nationalise rail services
attributes.background: The rail services are too expensive and always late, nationalising them would make them accountable to the public and would mean the profits earnt would actually be reinvested in the train services.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2016/may/13/rail-companies-trains-on-time-delays-cancellations-punctuality?client=safari

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/35790137?client=safari

http://www.itv.com/news/meridian/2016-07-19/southern-rail-more-trains-cancelled-and-delayed-despite-emergency-timetable/

attributes.action: Create a single Bullying Law that applies to all Schools in England
attributes.background: Schools are letting pupils down by not taking Bullying seriously and ignoring their policies. There needs to be a Law on Bullying that all Schools have to abide by. There are Children taking their own lives and i feel this would stop if there was a law that made schools help.
attributes.additional_details: News Articles. My own experience with my Child. I have spoken to numerous other Parents about their experiences too

attributes.action: Put in place aid stations across the UK where the homeless can have hot food.
attributes.background: It is shameful that in 2017 people are living on the streets with very little support.  I want a concerted effort,  Multi agency,  To eradicate this to the history books including access to medical help and basic hygiene facilities.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fortification of milk and other foodstuffs with Vitamin D.
attributes.background:
Finding tasty foods that are high in Vitamin D is a challenging task.

The majority of the UK population suffers from Vitamin D deficiencies. 
Government must act to prevent the continuing rise in bone diseases such as rickets through mandatory Vitamin D food fortification, as in USA and Canada.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the BBC "Vitamin D deficiency is likely to affect over half the UK's white population, up to 90% of the multi-ethnic population and a quarter of all children living in Britain."

The British Medical Journal recently published a journal saying fortifying foods with Vitamin D (adding Vitamin D to food) would reduce the risk of illness and improve bone and muscle health.

The SACN has also urged an increase in the RDA of Vitamin D to 10 µg/day (400 IU/d), throughout the year.

attributes.action: reinstate b+e entitlement on all driving licences after 1st Jan 1997.
attributes.background:
Allow drivers since 1st January 1997 to be able legally tow a trailer upto 3500kg.
Current legislation is costly to the user and stops the independence of many hobbies.

attributes.action: Raise £9 billion a year to fund the disastrous shortfall in the NHS
attributes.background:
The Kings Fund predicts an £8 billion a year shortfall to NHS funding by 2020/21. No government wants to deal with this deficit by raising income tax. 

A 2p in the pound rise in income tax would raise approx £9 billion a year.
This money could be 'ringfenced' for sole use by the NHS

attributes.action: We would like to get Creative Writing reinstated as an A- Level qualification
attributes.background: In 2018, the last exams of A-Level Creative Writing will run. This is  because the Department of Education and OFQUAL say that it doesn't meet their guidance and Nicky Morgan and Gove argue that it is not 'Academic' enough. We want to show them how academic it really is and show them why it matters.
attributes.additional_details: We want to argue against this. Michael Rosen said How about cutting art from art?. The government says that Creative Writing is too vocational yet they don't know how academic it really is.Otherwise why would it be offered at university? Furthermore, they want more 'academic' subjects such as English Literature to prove their worth but many teenagers find this difficult due to much writing being written in the elaborated code which puts children from a working class background at a disadvantage.

attributes.action: British & European Citizenship for those who wish to remain a part of Europe.
attributes.background: Given that there is precedent for dual nationality in N.Ireland I feel it is only fair, and morally right, that as just under half of the country didn't want to leave the EU that those who wish to stay should have the option to keep European citizenship when Brexit negotiations begin.
attributes.additional_details:
I was born in N.Ireland and as I grew up I was told I was N.Irish, Irish, British and European. I had a choice on who I affiliated myself with and I had a choice to be a part of something smaller, or something bigger; I chose the latter.

It is therefore, with precedent and just under half the country having voted to remain, that the government should not ignore what is a large minority and give everyone the rights that others in these islands already have.

Choice on citizenship!

attributes.action: Ban Dustbin lorries from operating between the school-run and rush hours
attributes.background: Dustbin lorries are a major obstruction during school-run and rush hours. it causes chaos and leads to workers and children being late at school/work and should be banned during the hours of 8:30am-9:30am working days
attributes.additional_details: We all know the frustration first thing in the morning when you rushing to work or dropping off your children at school and being stuck 20-30 minutes and then get the telling off! why are you late again? So we are asking throughout this one hour that they should operate only in main roads.

attributes.action: No tolls on Mersey Gateway or Jubilee bridges for Halton residents.
attributes.background: Tolls on local bridges will cost Halton residents £1000 per year and will divide Runcorn and Widnes.
attributes.additional_details: This was reported by BBC North West news on Thursday 26th of January.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Increase the standard paid length of Paternity Leave in the UK to 4 weeks.
attributes.background:
I have recently completed 2 weeks Paternity Leave after my first child was born. 
It really isn't enough time, the time it takes to properly bond with your child is vastly beyond what is currently allowed. 
It should be totally optional but I believe the government should increase the paid time.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for shops to tell customers that they sell real fur
attributes.background: Many people believe that the fur industry is a thing of the past and is no longer 'fashionable,' however this is far from the truth. While it has been illegal since 2002 to farm animals for fur in the UK, it is still able to be imported, making it a £500 million industry in the UK every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.animalaid.org.uk/images/pdf/factfiles/fur.pdf

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/25/faux-fur-or-real_n_8648146.html

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-wear/fur-trade/

attributes.action: Phase out LED headlights.
attributes.background: LED headlights are a lot brighter than normal headlights and dazzle other drivers, particularly on dark roads (i.e. on country lanes). Please put safety above looks and phase out LED headlights by making them illegal in any future car productions.

attributes.action: Not new grammar schools, put the funding into high achieving comprehensives.
attributes.background: In September, PM Theresa May announced the government's plans to reintroduce selective state education in the form of grammar schools. Students are selected by 11+ exams, not the age to be determining the schooling for the next 7 years. The government should prioritise existing comprehensives.
attributes.additional_details: The Government want these schools to be allowed to be created once again. This was not what was voted for in the 2015 Conservative manifesto, David Cameron was highly against grammar schools. The money should go to the success that is comprehensive schools. Studies have shown that comprehensive students have fared better at university and they achieve, even with non selection, competitive grades, why should the government try to separate students rather than fund comprehensive schooling more?

attributes.action: Making the Cervical Cancer Vaccination free on the NHS for women 35 and under.
attributes.background: I recently turned 19 years old, and have discovered that  on the NHS I am no longer eligible to be Vaccinated against Cervical Cancer. Cervical Cancer is the most common type of Cancer in Women under 35, and this Vaccination could change that.
attributes.additional_details: Girls to get Vaccinated in schools, but if a girl was to miss this and then circumstances occurred where she never received it prior to being 18, then she will remain unprotected for the rest of her life.

attributes.action: We ask the UK Government to seek to remove Turkey from NATO
attributes.background: Turkey has a consistent record of failing to comply with the necessary Human Rights standards and has very clearly engaged in military actions against essential allies.  Its treatment of the Kurds is a particular example.  Its close relations with Russia render it a security hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is some of the evidence:

https://www.hrw.org/world-report/2017/country-chapters/turkey

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_of_Kurdish_people_in_Turkey

attributes.action: The BBC should not be able to resell programs on DVD or download
attributes.background: The BBC is funded by the public . We who pay the TV license have already financed the BBC's programing why must we pay twice . Its a rip off were legally forced to pay to pay the BBC so why should they be able to sell the same program twice . we the people funded them so we own there programs
attributes.additional_details:
If I buy a sausage roll I don't pay once to pick it up then again to eat it 
Nobody charges you twice on the same purchase its a rip off and it shouldn't be allowed

attributes.action: Allow Robert Chilowa to stay in the UK
attributes.background:
- He saved two children from a house fire in Manchester

A man has been told he will be deported from the UK weeks after he saved two children from a house fire in Manchester. Robert Chilowa, who was commended by police for the rescue, said the order felt like a “slap in the face”.
attributes.additional_details:
He ran out of his house barefoot when he heard screams in the early hours of 10 February. A girl who had jumped from the building told him her siblings were still inside. Fighting the heat and smoke, he called up and told the two youngsters to jump and he would catch them.  

His bravery “truly demonstrated community spirit”, police and fire chiefs said, and more lives could have been lost but for his “noble” actions, along with other neighbours.

attributes.action: Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
attributes.background:
Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.

This means employers can force people to immediately return to work or go unpaid/use their holiday, which is unacceptable & counter-productive for well-being.
attributes.additional_details:
With the news that Facebook allows 20 days bereavement leave (http://bbc.in/2kYZd1J), I'm reminded of when my mother died and I was forced to use my holiday entitlement to grieve and take care of practical matters.

Media coverage shows I'm not alone in experiencing this (http://bbc.in/1gGBED7) and it highlights a dire lack of protection for workers' mental well-being, which should be a main consideration of the state and employers.

I suggest a min. 5 days paid leave. Small businesses exempt.

attributes.action: Re-evaluate the Council House Programme
attributes.background: We need to re-evaluate the Council House Programme as Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they are facing homelessness (as long as they haven't made themselves intentionally homeless)
attributes.additional_details: Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they're facing homelessness and then when they're back on their feet and are able to afford to either private rent or get a mortgage, the council should assist them with this, & then this council house can then be made available again for those who really need it. (Also need a large nationwide building programme to reimburse the council House stock, & until then the Right To Buy should be stopped)

attributes.action: Cap energy prices so that families do not struggle to keep their homes warm.
attributes.background: The Big Six energy firms are profiteering from ripping off British Customers. They should be held accountable for putting families such as those on benefits in to fuel poverty, especially when the winters are getting colder.

attributes.action: Remove the powers local authorities have to switch off street lights at  night.
attributes.background: Several authorities have switched off street lights at night, regardless of possible crime and safety consequences. The latest is Surrey County Council, to save £210,000 a year, a mere pittance in relative terms, and an amount that could surely be saved by, for example, axing the Chief Exec post.

attributes.action: All new public transport buses to be either electric or hydrogen fuel by 2018.
attributes.background: Health campaigners say Britain is facing an “air pollution crisis”.  It is estimated that the lives of 40,000 to 50,000 people in the UK are ended prematurely every year.  Yet technology exists to solve this problem.  By introducing new zero emission buses, dirty diesel buses will be phased out.

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Insurance for cyclists
attributes.background: Cyclists use the road on a day to day basis. If they use the road, they should have to pay for it like we do. If they crash into your car causing damage, you end up footing the cost and losing your No Claims Bonus. They should have their own insurance for using the road.
attributes.additional_details: A car is damaged by a cyclists cycling without due care and attention, who has to pay for the damage? You do through your insurance which has a great affect on you. If that was a car, their insurance would pay so therefore cyclists should be treated the same and have to have insurance to cover themselves. This also means obeying the rules of the road such as stopping at red-lights and not using bus lanes.

attributes.action: Establish a list of acredited Business Consultants/Mentor organisations.
attributes.background: Business Consultants offer valuable advice to government and SMEs yet remain unregulated.  It is proposed that when engaging, recommending, or working with Business Consultants government bodies and SMEs should be able to refer to an approved provider list of organisations and agencies.
attributes.additional_details: SMEs are seen as the growth engine of the economy yet there is little information for the inexperienced to identify who are credible business consultants and who are not.  There is no overarching governance mechanism, and yet we see numerous initiatives and grants seeking to help this sector. To this extent making available a list of accrediting organisations who exercise not only a quality control scheme for their members but ongoing educational programmes, for example as offered by, the Association of Business Mentor (a body of professional mentors) or such organisations as ibd Business Advice Group (ibd-uk.com – a group of business consultants) would protect both end user and provider.

attributes.action: Change the Bus Services Bill so authorities are allowed to set up bus companies.
attributes.background: We the undersigned object to section 21 (1) of the Bus Services Bill 2016 as it stops local authorities from having the freedom to form municipal bus companies and we want this clause erased from the final bill.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill can be viewed at http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0058/lbill_2016-20170058_en_1.htm

Authorities should have the ability to set up municipal bus companies. It is essential that councils have the power to best meet the transport needs of citizens, for example cities with Mayors should be allowed to follow the model laid out by Transport For London. 

Carefully considered, reliable and affordable public transport is essential to modern life.

attributes.action: Negotiate for British citizens to exchange citizenship with other EU nationals.
attributes.background: We call on the government to negotiate an agreement with the EU, or failing that bilateral agreements where possible with member states of the EU, to permit British Citizens who wish to remain EU citizens to exchange their citizenship with citizens of those member states who wish to become British.
attributes.additional_details: As the situations of the many EU nationals living in the UK, and the many British citizens living throughout the EU, are now highly uncertain, and as many British citizens wish not to lose their EU citizenship as a result of the UK Government's leaving the EU, and as many EU citizens, especially those who have lived and worked long in the UK, wish to remain in the UK, this would allow numbers to remain stable, and ensure those in the UK genuinely wished to be British.

attributes.action: Bring an end to Fast Track Fitness Instructor/Personal Trainer courses
attributes.background:
Training providers who offer you a chance to call yourself a Fitness Professional after a few days need to be stopped.
If these companies are not stopped the standard of Fitness Instructors will keep dropping while the obesity rate gets higher.
Call Full Enquiry into the awarding bodies
attributes.additional_details:
here is an example of types of courses that need to be stopped


https://focus-training.com/courses/full-time-gym-instructor-courses/

If you would like to join discusson on this subject my facebok group is ''Fitness Professionals Association''.

attributes.action: Introduce stricter air pollution laws in the uk eg. stronger fines.
attributes.background: This year 24 areas in London reached the highest recorded levels of pollution in 5 years. This also happened in several areas in Western Europe effecting people with breathing disabilities. We need to lead in environmental issues as we have great influence. This will prompt other countries to follow
attributes.additional_details: The information is a reference to the observers article on pollution, published on the 29th January 2017 (Sunday) titled: Smog In the cities: the truth about Britain's dirty air.

attributes.action: Open Drug Crisis Centres. stop death and crime with compassion and help.
attributes.background: It is a fact the war on drugs is not working. People are dying without help or a chance to get help.  Glasgow has just  opened its doors on a Drug crisis centre. It helps people to handle and control their substance abuse, offers help guidance and rehabilitation to those who would like to get better
attributes.additional_details: If you want to know more about how drug prohibition does not work. A good book is Chasing the Scream or Neil Woods, book Good cop, Bad war. It does not matter how much we spend trying to stop use of drugs it does not ease the problem it just makes it worse. Canada had a massive drug problem until they opened up safe centres for people to use and to get help. Portugal have stopped making drugs illegal and again the problems are being tackled, less death and crime. More Compassion4Progression

attributes.action: Brain scans for anyone entering  hospital with head injurys as protocol
attributes.background: When a person has an injury to their head the damage isn't always visible so let's spread the word to get brain scans offered as protocol to anyone entering the hospital with a head injury.
attributes.additional_details: Please help brain injuries get noticed quicker and before it totally changes a family's life by signing this petition, as recently a friend of mine lost their son due to a head injury which he was admitted to hospital with the staff stitched his head and discharged him hours later he was rushed in as collapsed and ended up in a

attributes.action: Make PTSD a recognised illness for fair claim and recognition of PIP at DWP.
attributes.background: I would like the government to re-address the level of illness, disability and point scoring of PIP claims for PTSD. British people need fair claim for the illness that is debilitating and get the help in such times of need. There is apparent great need for this within the ex-services community.
attributes.additional_details: I tried claiming PIP on the encouragement of my social worker before medical discharg for PTSD. Following the interview for PIP, which was distresssing enough, I was given zero points, even though on the letter I received it stateded I obviously had some form of mental illness at this time. I could get nothing as it's not classed as a health condition or disability. I am well now but would have benefitted from the extra income, as I was unable to do many activitys of daily living due to my PTSD.

attributes.action: Take action to make victims feel more able to report sexual violence.
attributes.background: According to "An overview of Sexual Offending"(Jan 2013) 57% of women who have been raped told someone but not the police, 28% told no one. More must be done to ensure that victims feel able to report incidents and be taken seriously. I suggest closer collaboration with charities such as rape crisis
attributes.additional_details:
See "An Overview of Sexual Offendinf in England and Wales" (Ministry of Justice, Home Office &a Office for National Statistics) for more general statistics. 
I submit this petition in the hope that it will prompt wider debate about the way in which sexual violence is treated within the criminal justice system and how victims are treated.

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for Parkinsons sufferers
attributes.background: Cannabis relieves Parkinsons symptoms and dyskinesia caused by Parkinsons drugs

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: Businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on.
attributes.background:
Its time to create a law that all businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on. 
If everyone does it we can beat the myth that open doors in winter are welcoming, and we can do our part to cut our heating bills and contribute to saving the environment at the same time.
